<a id="Sprite3D"></a>

# Sprite3D

**Inherits:** [SpriteBase3D](SpriteBase3D.md) **\<** [GeometryInstance3D](GeometryInstance3D.md) **\<** [VisualInstance3D](VisualInstance3D.md) **\<** [Node3D](Node3D.md) **\<** [Node](Node.md) **\<** [Object](Object.md)

2D sprite node in a 3D world.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

A node that displays a 2D texture in a 3D environment. The texture displayed can be a region from a larger atlas texture, or a frame from a sprite sheet animation. See also [SpriteBase3D](SpriteBase3D.md) where properties such as the billboard mode are defined.

<!-- classref-reftable-group -->

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Property Descriptions

<a id="Sprite3D_property_frame"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[int](int.md) **frame** = `0` [ðŸ”—](#Sprite3D_property_frame)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_frame**\ (\ value\: [int](int.md)\ )
- [int](int.md) **get_frame**\ (\ )

Current frame to display from sprite sheet. [hframes](Sprite3D.md#Sprite3D_property_hframes) or [vframes](Sprite3D.md#Sprite3D_property_vframes) must be greater than 1. This property is automatically adjusted when [hframes](Sprite3D.md#Sprite3D_property_hframes) or [vframes](Sprite3D.md#Sprite3D_property_vframes) are changed to keep pointing to the same visual frame (same column and row). If that's impossible, this value is reset to ``0``.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Sprite3D_property_frame_coords"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Vector2i](Vector2i.md) **frame_coords** = `Vector2i(0, 0)` [ðŸ”—](#Sprite3D_property_frame_coords)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_frame_coords**\ (\ value\: [Vector2i](Vector2i.md)\ )
- [Vector2i](Vector2i.md) **get_frame_coords**\ (\ )

Coordinates of the frame to display from sprite sheet. This is as an alias for the [frame](Sprite3D.md#Sprite3D_property_frame) property. [hframes](Sprite3D.md#Sprite3D_property_hframes) or [vframes](Sprite3D.md#Sprite3D_property_vframes) must be greater than 1.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Sprite3D_property_hframes"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[int](int.md) **hframes** = `1` [ðŸ”—](#Sprite3D_property_hframes)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_hframes**\ (\ value\: [int](int.md)\ )
- [int](int.md) **get_hframes**\ (\ )

The number of columns in the sprite sheet. When this property is changed, [frame](Sprite3D.md#Sprite3D_property_frame) is adjusted so that the same visual frame is maintained (same row and column). If that's impossible, [frame](Sprite3D.md#Sprite3D_property_frame) is reset to ``0``.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Sprite3D_property_region_enabled"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **region_enabled** = `false` [ðŸ”—](#Sprite3D_property_region_enabled)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_region_enabled**\ (\ value\: [bool](bool.md)\ )
- [bool](bool.md) **is_region_enabled**\ (\ )

If ``true``, the sprite will use [region_rect](Sprite3D.md#Sprite3D_property_region_rect) and display only the specified part of its texture.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Sprite3D_property_region_rect"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Rect2](Rect2.md) **region_rect** = `Rect2(0, 0, 0, 0)` [ðŸ”—](#Sprite3D_property_region_rect)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_region_rect**\ (\ value\: [Rect2](Rect2.md)\ )
- [Rect2](Rect2.md) **get_region_rect**\ (\ )

The region of the atlas texture to display. [region_enabled](Sprite3D.md#Sprite3D_property_region_enabled) must be ``true``.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Sprite3D_property_texture"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Texture2D](Texture2D.md) **texture** [ðŸ”—](#Sprite3D_property_texture)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_texture**\ (\ value\: [Texture2D](Texture2D.md)\ )
- [Texture2D](Texture2D.md) **get_texture**\ (\ )

[Texture2D](Texture2D.md) object to draw. If [GeometryInstance3D.material_override](GeometryInstance3D.md#GeometryInstance3D_property_material_override) is used, this will be overridden. The size information is still used.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Sprite3D_property_vframes"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[int](int.md) **vframes** = `1` [ðŸ”—](#Sprite3D_property_vframes)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_vframes**\ (\ value\: [int](int.md)\ )
- [int](int.md) **get_vframes**\ (\ )

The number of rows in the sprite sheet. When this property is changed, [frame](Sprite3D.md#Sprite3D_property_frame) is adjusted so that the same visual frame is maintained (same row and column). If that's impossible, [frame](Sprite3D.md#Sprite3D_property_frame) is reset to ``0``.
